review: I'll be honest I'm generally not like oh let's go to chili's but I went for lunch today and the service was great. While we were shooting the breeze with our server she had keyed in our drinks on her tablet and they got delivered before we completed the order. We both had the lunch fajitas, just the right size portion.  Service was great and we didn't need to hit the refill button on the table tablet.

The service is superb she is always on top of her game, and ensuring if were okay. The sanitation of the restaurant is excellent, but could use a little cleaning but overall it's a clean restaurant just do a touch up on areas. The bathroom was clean. When it comes to The food the mash potatoes need more butter, the steak was good around the edges, but burnt underneath the middle, and green beans need cut to bite size.

Great service tonight.  Ivy kept the Drinks coming. Our food was hot, just not too flavorful.  Food: Burger was dry and gritty. Chips were undercooked. Three to eight tortillas deep fried together and not cooked in the middle--- gross. Our sweet server, Ivy brought us a new basket which were much better.  Our flatware was also dirty. Thankfully don't need any for a burger and fries.  Overall service is great; Food is not.

This is by far the best brunch for under $20.00  Four of us had brunch there and it was amazing. A large verity of food to chose from. You would think it might be slim for the price but that is further then the truth. Everything from eggs, bacon,sliced beef, eggs to order, chicken sliced, salads, dessert, etc.

Highly disappointed.  Hubby got endless soup and salad.  They came back one time, fifteen minutes after my husband finished his plates.  They would not acknowledge our table.  They came back once to give us endless chips and salsa.  Waiting for them to come by after we were done eating, wanting boxes, we waited an additional 15 minutes.  As they kept going to nearby tables and ignoring us.  Finally my husband got up, walked over to the boxes and got his own.  Would have been nice had waitresses done their job.
Super easy in and out for pickup orders. The girl who helped me was super nice and helpful. And let's talk about the chicken enchilata soup..... mmmmmmm.

Came here with party of 8. Waited half an hour even though the place was half empty. Horrendous and lackluster service. It seems the servers here aren't either paid enough or just don't care. Very unorganized.

The Atacama Desert in South America is considered to be the driest place on earth. Officially my mouth is now the driest place on earth. The oceans called they want their salt back. Chili's, turn down the volume of salt in the food, please! The menu at chili's is vast but so is the canyon of salt they use to cook with. I can go on and on all day about the level of salt in their food. Why do they need to make everything so salty? A hamburger is delicious on its own merits, is it not? A chicken breast sandwich with all the topics taste great, doesn't it? So why all the salt? I guess it is to mask the quality of the meat they use. I am not sure but what ever the reason please stop.  Let me try and get off the topic of overly salted food and get to something more important. Flimsy nacho chips! Why? Chips and Salsa are one of the best things Mexican culture has ever given us. It is an attack on their culture to create meager chips and watery salsa. Your guacamole should be given a name change and just be called "Pale Green Stew". I can't say everything is bad. The servers have always been helpful. Especially now that you can pay with the on table kiosk. The drinks are good, the kind with alcohol of course. If you need a cheap place to drink with some co-workers or a night out with the friends, this is a good spot. I would have given it one star but I do like the appetizer menu. Sometimes it is my entire meal. Unless I want to be an unwanted addition to the Macy's day parade this year, I will be avoiding Chili's. Sorry!

I usually love Chili's food and they almost always have great service. This time was the exception. I went for lunch with a coworker on 1/10 at about 12:45. We sat at a 2 top booth in the bar. There were about 4 people sitting at the bar and 2 other 2 tops. Not busy. We were there at least 4 minutes before being greeted by the server. She was also the bartender, I have restaurant bar experience so I get that sometimes you get tied up. She finally said she would be right with us. Which was another 2 or 3 minutes. She finally came over to clean off the table and, instead of getting drink orders, walked away and cleaned another table. I should also mention she needs to learn the scoop and wipe trick on the tables if you have guests sitting at the table already. Luckily the table was clean or we would have crumbs in our laps. She finally took drink orders and, since we had so much time, we also knew our food order. We ordered the big mouth bites and quesadilla from what we thought was the $7 lunch menu. She brought the drinks and set them down without saying anything. When she came back I asked if she had a straw on her. She apparently mumbled something about it being in the little silverware packet, which I did not hear, and walked away. I repeated the question. She turned around and pointed at the packet with some serious snarky attitude. When the food arrived it was the full portion. We checked the bill and sure enough were charged for the regular menu price. We told her we thought we were ordering the lunch option. She says, "well that comes with soup or salad and since you didn't say you wanted those things I assumed you wanted the regular option". Listen, I don't work for Chili's. But she does. I don't know the menu without looking at it or without prompted questions. If someone is there during lunch and you have a lunch menu, wouldn't it be common courtesy to ask if they wanted the lunch or regular option? We only ate half of each anyway which is the lunch portion, cause that's all we wanted. So we asked her if it could be adjusted to the $7 price and she kind of just looked at it and said, "well I can ask" and stormed off then had someone else deliver the check. When she came back to get the plates I said thank you and she did not respond.  She just seemed annoyed the entire time. I didn't catch her name because she didn't care to offer it. She was kind of plain and had dark hair. I understand that we all have bad days but in the service industry, honey, you don't get to show it. A lot of times, your guests are there to escape their bad day. They don't need yours on top of it. On the plus, the food was good, which is why I gave the 2nd star.

Good food, fast service. Never had to wait for a table. A friend and I were talking about a sauce we didn't like. Guess someone heard us. The manager came over to see if she could get us something else.

Food was cold. Ordered ribs and queso dip. I always get there queso, usually it's HOT and meaty. I think they changed the recipe it was basically just cheese that was lukewarm. The ribs were lukewarm as well and my broccoli barely steamed. My husband and I used to come here all the time, we loved it! I honestly don't think we'll ever be back. We got here at 11am they just opened! How are your ribs not hot!? It just shows that they're pre cooked. Anyway, the service was great we didn't have to pay for our food, they were very apologetic, the server and manager.

Chillis food is just not that great. I ordered the smoked smothered burrito which was supposed to be smothered with sour cream on top and when it came it was so dry. I had to ask for more sour cream to put inside. Our server (who's name I forgot) was not that friendly at all and at times M.I.A.  The queso dip with beans wasn't all that great either. Needless to say I don't really care for their food.  The strawberry lemonade is AMAZING though !!!!
Pleasantly surprised by the food.  Chicken and waffles were awesome.   Chipotle honey baby back ribs melt in your mouth.   Great food and service.

First the server was very rude about us being able to get happy hour at our table! The bar was jammed pack with one high table left.. not wanting to have my 5 year old on those kinds of tables. Then we told her that the manager already said that it was okay and she then argued and said.. wow really that shouldn't happen.. I then said yes the hosts asked him and she said wow she shouldn't have even asked!!! Really!! What kind of customer service is that! Very disappointed with my service so far hope it gets better!!

My daughter and i decided to go to chilis today for a nice lunch since its been so hot and all . Our overall experience was just Ok .  Our meals were Ok not great not bad just in the middle I guess . Our waitress was great very attentive ! We'll be back

The quac is crap, the mango lemonade is gross, and a side of honey chipotle sauce smells like shrimp cocktail, but the people are super nice! Seriously the hostess had a smile before we even walked in and she remained with it. It was a genuine smile. The waiter was beyond polite and very quick. I didn't notice I was waiting for food and I always notice.

Dear chilis We popped in for a quick bite before the movie We'd requested to sit in the bar at the first open table in the bar for the sake of expediency and time Apparently this was the table not to be waited on, ever We sat there politely and quietly for almost 20 minutes without being observed, addressed, recognized or even rudely ignored It seemed we were invisible, so after the above mentioned 20 minutes of blissfully being ignored, we left The end It was at 7:40 Friday night, had three youngsters manning the hostess station and total lack of followup and followthrough was pretty evident

Just don't go here...ever. We tried it yet another time, hoping it would be better.  It was worse! Service was terrible!  It was NOT very busy but no service...drinks empty, chips empty, table packed with plates and cups and it took FOREVER to get the bill and pay. OVERCHARGED on my bill.  Talked to the manager who "fixed" the bill...but added 2 small charges to the bill.  VERY frustrating! Others were having issues with wrong orders, service and food quality.   Many things were over cooked and honestly the overall taste was missing. We used to LOVE Chilis...I am afraid the old days are gone.

I really love the ancho salmon.  It was perfectly cooked however.... The burger was dryyyyyy... The steaks we asked medium rare and it was rare this interrupts the dinner when they don't listen what you ask for.  Service was ok.  The loaded potato soup was amazing..

We took our grandson and his wife and sons to here yesterday after we went to a movie with them nearby.  The food was very good, the server was attentive and the prices were ok.  We had a nice enjoyable supper together.

For me, getting consistently good service and food is always hit or miss at bars like Chili's, Friday's or Applebees... but this Chili's never disappoints! My wife and I love to do the 2 for $35 deal included an appetizer, 2 entrees, dessert, and 2 margaritas. I seriously think that's one of the best deals in town.  The only downside at this place is definitely parking... it's shared with Black Angus customers so on a Friday or Saturday night, you might be circling for 10 minutes before you find a spot. But you can also save some time and get on their wait list through the mobile Yelp app ;)
My favorite place for drinks and appetizers at the bar. Fun atmosphere. Best bartenders in town. As a single guy, this fits for me Movies right next door for a good date night.

Waited over 45 minutes before they told us it would be another 20-30 min before we could be seated. There were plenty of tables. They told us they were under staffed. Called across the street to Black Angus and asked if there was a wait. They said they could seat us immediately. So we enjoyed a great meal with great service. They even gave us a discount without a coupon. I won't be going back to Chili's.
We had a party of 11. Called ahead for a table. We were at this place for two hours! All food was cold. Had to ask several times for drinks and refills. Horrible birthday dinner for our son.

Yay!!  Chili's finally impressed!  I'm so glad to be upgrading my review from one to four stars!! I thought I had sworn off Chili's after a few horrible experiences, but we had a gift card and a long day, so it was a convenient option.  The hubs and I started off with a Cuervo Blue Margarita and it really hit the spot.  So refreshing! We both also decided to stick with the lite menu.  I'm really impressed when somebody makes a lite choice flavorful.  It's not that difficult but far too often, lite is interpreted as no flavor.  Chili's hit it out of the park with this.  I ordered the ancho salmon.  It was absolutely delicious and cooked perfectly...not overcooked and dry like I often end up receiving.  The veggies were also cooked to perfection, not too hard and not too mushy.  The hubs ordered the margarita chicken.  I tried it and it was equally delicious.  He enjoyed it so much that he wants to recreate the dish at home.  My son always orders the burger with the egg if it's on the menu.  So, he went with the grassfed sunrise burger.  He loved it!  Our service was also exceptional.  Everything about this visit was great.  Had this been my first visit I probably would've given five stars but it's really hard to forget my last experience.  However, Chili's definitely gained back my business and maybe that five star review is in the future.  Nice job!
This an all American food place this place has a nice duck pond to see and food is good, service is normal

Decided to order last min instead of Grub Hub. Burger was cooked perfectly!! The instructions on leaving out the ranch on the quesadilla were listened too and service was fast and so friendly!!! Best take out service in a long time!! Thank y'all for making my experience a great one.

Very disappointed in our visit this evening poor service due to under staffing food was just poor quality even for chili's with the exception of the ribs they were cooked right and did taste good ordered a second drink after waiting 20 mins checked out at the table box and left.
The food and drinks are pretty awesome.  The only reason I didn't give 5  is because our waitress never checked in on us.  Everytime we needed anything, we had to look for her and wave her down.
Hit the high bar tonight. Service was FAST and all went well. I asked for extra honey and it was on the order.  Presidents Margarita was awesome!!

So i ordered the chicken crispers and they were anything but crispy. They were so greasy that the chicken inside was soggy but the server alerted the manager who came over on his own apologizes and offered to remake but i wasn't feeling it so he gave a courtesy comp. I wasn't even going to complain or ask for a credit. Now that is above and beyond Customer Service. Thank you.

Had dinner the 2 for $22.00 and it was GREAT! The food was HOT and the service was fantastic. Our waitress name was Aerial and she is a STAR! Very professional and she treats the customers with respect! Give that lady a bonus!

We had a great happy hour tonight at the Temecula Chili's. Very good service and the manager assisted with a fee issues getting chips and salsa and a dessert to show up under my awards. The only drawback is my favorite craft beers weren't apart of happy hour. But it's not a deal breaker. We will be back!
This is our to go lunch and dinner for several years now ... kids love the place  Service is always great and the food is just right.

I've always enjoyed chilis but it can be hit or miss. This visit was a definite hit. We got seated right away and our server was really attentive. I never had to ask for a refill or for extra sauces, she asked me before I got the chance to bring it up so that was nice. The food was delicious this time around and it came out pretty quick. I got the sunrise burger and it did not disappoint but it was extremely messy. The place was not very busy but we got stuck in the corner next to the kitchen, but it wasn't too noisy or anything. Only one side of the table had views of a TV. Check out was easy on the tablet kiosk at the table.
I like this location  They have all the NFL games on Sunday and solid specials The service and staff is good and a fun atmosphere to watch games
Sunday funday! Watching my Steelers and enjoying all day happy hour in the bar. Service is really good here, food is really good here and you can't beat the price! Thank you!

We went to Chili's because of their pet friendly patio. We were welcomed with open arms. Our server was GREAT! Food came fast and was hot and very good. They accommodated us and even let us order Happy Hour from the bar while seated outside. I mean an all day happy hour on sundays!?!? Sign me up. I will be returning very soon. Thank you Chili's!!
Their happy hour menu is small. We just had chips and salsa. The beer was good no complaints.
JOsh took our phone order over the phone and he was fabulous! Very nice and efficient. He is an asset to CHilis.
We had lunch at the bar, no drinks... Josh at the bar gave the best service I think I've ever had at any Chili's. I'll definitely come back if this is how all their servers are.

This spot is a good Chilis... Always get good service here and the wait times are reasonable. The food is always good and haven't had any issues as yet... Their chicken enchilada soup is AWESOME! And the Honey Chipotle Crispers are awesome!!!

Went to Chilies to day for a to go order.  I ordered the Mango Chili Chicken with black beans, citrus chili rice, a side of fries, and a strawberry lemonade.  When I got the food my mouth dropped open.  I thought they must have given me a child's order.  The chicken was so tiny, like a snack.  The chicken was only 4' by 3', by just over 1/2' inch thick.  Unlike the picture from on line which showed a pile of mango, and at least half an avocado, I hot a few tiny crumbs of mango, and 2 tiny crumbs of avocado, maybe the size of my pinky nail.  So ridiculous, really a joke.  The chicken was weird, like rubber.  I got a small scoop of rice and beans, with maybe 1 teaspoon of peco de gio.  The rice was awful, like it came from a really bad .99 cent box.  The beans taste like it came out of a can.  The strawberry lemonade taste like a weird sugary kool aid punch.  The service was great.  However since the food was literally garbage there is no way I will ever go back.

Chili's has always been one of my favorite chain restaurants. I visited another location and the food was so terrible it almost make me never want to go to another Chili's ever again. Well this place definitely reminded me of my love for Chili's! The service was superb, the food came out timely, and the food was as perfect as it gets. I ordered loaded potato soup which is always so good as well as a chicken buffalo ranch sandwich. Both excellent!  People who come here and expect good Mexican food must be out of their minds. It isn't a Mexican restaurant. They aren't known for mexican food just because their logo is a chili pepper lol! Chili's "baby back ribs"  Also for a fellow reviewer to give this restaurant a couple stars because a crow was eating a dead rat outside is just absurd!! As long as it wasn't in the restaurant, who the heck cares!?
Thank you Paige for great service!! Didn't even ask for my kids meal to be split up (they were sharing) but she did it anyways! Thank you!

It was date night so we decided to go to Chili's. The food was okay, but what really made our night was our waitress Paige. She was so sweet and funny, and she made us feel so welcome. We will be returning because of her.

Haven't been to Chili's in quite some time and decided to go again. The new menu items are awesome. Much better variety. Tired the triple dipper with the hubby and it was great! Loved the new onion rings and fried pickles!! Didn't care for the fried cheese though, sort of plan to me. Overall, the service was fabulous, the Host was very nice, the food was great and the prices were absolutely perfect! Loved it!

I dont usually write reviews unless a place is exceptional or horrendous. I am glad to say that this resturant is exceptional. Every employee I encountered on my visit was attentive, quick, and efficient. Even though Vincent was not our waiter, he did not hesitate to assist us when our waiter was unavailable. He was extremely polite and was able to balance our needs whilst seating people.
Service was great.  Food is always good - the spinach cheese dip hit the spot.
Love this Chili's! We go a few times a month. The wait staff is always friendly and attentive. The good is always fresh and as ordered. The table kiosk is awesome too!

Ok so this review is for a visit from about a month ago...DO NOT come here if you have a large party. We came in with about 22 adults for lunch one Saturday. We had made a reservation and had informed them that we would need separate checks. Upon being seated we asked for more of the tablets so we could have multiple people paying for checks at once and the server said she would split the checks and handle the payments because it would be easier and faster...well it WASN'T. It took her over an hour to split the checks, which were wrong and had to be fixed, and another 40 min to process them all. It was ridiculous. We had to involve management because it was taking so long and the manager was ZERO HELP. We were actually late for our event that we had all paid for already  because they were so unprepared to handle our group even though we made our reservations over a week in advance. On top of the check issue our general service was absolutely terrible, we had to go up to the bar to order drinks and ask the hostess for things multiple times because we rarely saw our server. Sorry but this location will not be on my list of places visit again.

Our server was great- krista.  Food was delicious.  We started with the spinach queso dip.  Chips are very thin so they break easy when dipping.  You can see through the actual chip.  I had a Mexican salad bowl thing and my husband had the 3 item Mexican fare.   Tons of food and delicious!

I love coming to this Chilis. Chelsee and Trevor are awesome. They always give me great customer service. The food is consistently delicious and I enjoy a lot of food on the menu. Great customer service and great food. Can't get any better than that.

Went for lunch today because the usual spot that I go to wasn't taking online orders (damn you Panera!). I found a Lighter Side steak item for just under 300 calories which is exactly what I need. I placed the order online and when I got there I was informed that my steak had been sitting out for about 40 min and was cold. The Asian guy at the front (Brandon?..) asked me if I had time for them to make me a new one. It only took about 10 min to make and it was pretty good. I was really impressed with the staff and their ability to be proactive and resolve something that could have potentially been an issue. He even offered me something to drink while I waited. It's the little things that go a long way.... Good lookin' out Chili's!
Always amazing service, prompt refills, great with to go service and they are not bothered when we have a chatty lunch.

We hadn't been to Chili's for over a year. We have been very pleasantly surprised by a recent visit and have returned several times since to discover it wasn't a one-time event. Chili's has really stepped up the level of food and service. We have discovered an amazing menu with exciting and excellent appetizers, meals, and drinks. If you haven't had the experience lately, we would highly recommend the trip. See you there!

Stopped in to watch collage football game, we sat in the bar. The blackberry iced tea was soooooo good! We also ordered the boneless buffalo wings, which were delish! Our waitress was friendly and on top of things!

Love this place.   Come here with my wife and or family at least once a week.   Food is always great.  Sundays for football have great deals.   Bartenders (Josh Espeacially) are always on point.   Good environment too.

Decided to come here after an eventful day at the casino. Started my meal with a cup of baked potato soup. It came and was cold. I mean soup is usually hot. Had to send it back to get reheated. Finally food comes out. I got the fajitas with the rice and beans on the side. And guess what. My rice and beans are cold. An im not talking about warmish. Its COLD! usually chilis is pretty good. Fajitas were eh. 4 pieces of thinly sliced meat is all i got and a boat load of bell peppers. I gave up on returning my food back. Blah. No bueno chilis

Chili's used to be my favorite. But things have really gone downhill. The service isn't that good, the food has gone down hill. Last visit my chicken was completely raw, it looked like they just tried to put it in the microwave. Everything else was okay.

Today, March 3 2016 at 11:00am, my mom and I ordered the California club and chicken sandwich. It was the first order of the day.  I was at the Togo desk and able to see my food being prepared. They accidentally put the wrong sides with the sandwich, so instead of washing his hands and choosing to move the fries to another box he just picked up my club sandwich and tossed it in a new box. I  opened my lunch and it looked more like a chopped salad with bread than a sandwich. The food was really good, except knowing that the sandwich, now in my stomach, had been manhandled by the bartender.
Horrible... took over an hour to be served food. When food finally came to table, it was dry or burnt. The manager didn't see to care, only offered desert on the house. Waitress was great.

First thing is we sit down with the window view and notice a disgusting mangy crow hopping around right outside the window. All three of us at the same time say, what the heck is that thing next to the crow?? It is a giant dead rat with a smashed head that we watched it pulled from the dumpster by our new crow friend. After a few more pecks it picked up the rat and flew away with it in its beak. It was the most disgusting and hilarious thing you would never expect to see right away after we sat down. On the food... if you want remotely decent Mexican food go to a Mexican restaurant not Chili's. (fajita's are ok) I tried the new grilled smoked chicken burrito and it is shreaded chicken that tastes like it was re-purposed and not even close to del taco quality. Everyone at the table tried new mexican dishes and they all were below average.
You can't beat the 2 for $20. Plus an email coupon for a free dessert on top of that = satisfied customers. :)

I was so grateful for our waitress Mary! She was so helpful with the menu - I have a few challenging food allergies (gluten & dairy) which makes eating out for meals extremely difficult - I was able to narrow down a few options & enjoy a perfect easy day date with my man! Their table side electronic devices (sorry for the lack of technical verbiage there) made scanning the allergies extremely easy! The food was yummy - no wait - and football was on.

Poor excuse for customer service. Renee was our server. I guess smiling wasn't her strong point but also not checking back to our table until we asked for the check wasn't a strong point for hers either. All we ordered was an app and a flatbread, I wanted an extra dipping sauce & hot sauce to go with my meal but had to eat it without cause she never came to check back on us. Also We wanted a dessert but I wasn't gonna wait another year to order. I thought it was quit ridiculous how she checked back with the table right next to us 3 times before she even glanced over at our table. Mind you she only had 1 other tables...i know it was close to closing time but seriously? Don't try to rush costumers out. I like the location but if order again it's going to be to go cause I can do without the lack of Renee's basic customer service skills.

This Chili's has become the date-night spot for me and my boyfriend and we're always pleased with the service. We have gone at a lot of different times and don't ever have trouble finding a seat at the bar, although Saturday night is usually last on our list because we don't like the wait.  Service at the bar is always fast and efficient. We love Jimmy and Matt, they are great bartenders that know their stuff, give us all the options and prices in advance, and make great drinks! We usually just stick with appetizers or burgers and we're always happy. Love their chips and salsa, and mango margaritas! Haven't had a bad experience yet.

Ill make this short and to the point,  my utensils and plate was dirty and not washed properly.  When i had  notified my waiter he kept giving me different plates and utensils that were dirty as well.  All my food and the food of my friends were dry and over cooked.  Im never coming back again.
Great service wifey was not thrilled with the short rib enchilada but my burger was great good service and a new check out device that moves you right along. All around good experience.

I think Chili's is one of the under rated family places around and people think you need to eat whole meals there to enjoy, but in fact this is not the case at all. its great for quick lunches or just a no cook at home dinner night, but you dont want to order in.. Mini-me and I really enjoy Chili's and for under 30.00 for a dinner or 20.00 for lunch/we have plenty to nosh on and believe me it is filling. And I don't mean under $30. For 2- although it easily is, I mean under $30.00 for 3 or 4 people- here is how I do it.....and my discclaimer is that these are some of the option we have worked out for us, so depending on how you order the price will be more or less. What seome people dont see is the fine print- if your orer the chili -queso- YOU Get the chips and sals with it, so you dont need to order it seperate. But sometimes we dont want the queso..  For 2 -3 People We do the 2 for $20. we love the chips and salsa and the fries since both are part of the appetizer combo I order the fries with the deal and chips/salsa on the side. The 2 for $20. portions are perfect size so you are really not over eating, actually we wind up filling up on the chips and salsa so the dinner pretty much goes home for lunch the next day- Might I add, the steamed broccoli at Chili's is probably the best tasting aside from Outback's we have ever had. For lunch we split the buffalo chicken salad, order the chips and salsa and fries. The salad split and is still a hearty portion and they don't skimp on the chicken just because you are splitting it. For 3 people we sometimes just do appetizers I mean order according to your taste and hunger chart 1-10- 10 being starving. I think that for your money you get really great options on the 2 for $20.00 menu. For 3-4 People  If you're like us sometimes you just don't want to cook, but you are not super hungry either and just want to maybe nibble or split stuff which sounds good- go to Chili's order 3-4 appetizers that's perfect. Chips /salsa, Fries, Cheese Queso--YUMMMM! Sure it's not your 7 pyramid food group or anything but add a salad with no dressing and everything on the side, LOL. Once again - pick and choose the variations are pretty good. Right now,  my Chili's is being re-modeled and it has not posed any issue with service or eating there- in fact most of you know my issue with screaming kids at restaurants, when I walk in my super- sonic hearing picks up the sounds of overly tired wee-ones, so when we are being seated it has never ever been a problem to ask to sit away from the exhausted parents in that area, sometimes they need to just get out and enjoy family time, so Chili's in that respect is super kid friendly and I appreciate that. I give 4-Stars only because the parking lot is a bit dangerous and needs to be smoothed out and less speedway friendly. For some reason people drive like maniacs in this particular parking lot and I have not been able to figure out why.

You can't go wrong with this place.  My son says they have the best chicken strips around.  They have a pretty good variety on the healthy entrees also.  Deserts are the bomb.  Lots to choose from and great staff.  You won't be disappointed.

My husband and I decided to eat before the movie, and decided to come to chili's here in Ynez rd which is a big mistake. We always go to Murrieta chili's and never had a problem. Nways. I ordered a tortilla soup and a salad. I am very disappointed when I ate my soup. Its not hot its cold & very salty. Then when I saw my salad, I was very shocked to see the cucumber, its frozen. I never had a salad with frozen cucumber. I asked to speak to the manager, and his very rude, sarcastic and very inconsiderate. He made a comment abt his a burger person & not a salad person. He thinks that its ok to make the customer feel stupid just cause his a manager. I can understand if the cucumber is just cold but frozen and old cucumber & serve it to your customer is not acceptable. As a custoner, I expect that the food supposed to be fresh and new when they serve it the customer I would not recommend this chili's in Ynez. Unless u want to feel disappointed and u want to waste your money, then see it for yourself.

The hostess took my name for a party of 8 and told me 45minutes to 1 hour so my family and I went out to the parking lot for about 20 minutes then came back in because the lobby was now clear. My wife asked the hostess how much longer and they had sat our table thinking it was another party of 8 and she told my wife that she told me 30 minutes and it could change but I know what she told me. The server was great but the food took 1 hour 20 minutes to get to ur. Over all we were there for 2 1/2 hours. My wife is in the restaurant business and knows things can happen but this was just unorganized.
The new lighter choices make for a great lunch. Nice, simple and it doesn't leave you hungry. This place is great place to relax and enjoy your food. It has a great view of the small water fountain.

Drinks are very weak, but the food is worth going! My steak was cooked perfectly, except the broccoli was a disgusting raw...not even cooked. My friends Mexican food was good and my husband loved his burger. They just don't know how to cook vegetables..but who eats them anyway lol.

OK. Chili's is good consistent restaurant with decent food and prices. What makes one location better than the rest is their customer service. Sunday, 9-14-20104 we ate the Temecula location on Ynez. We went in around lunch time. Bar was busy with football watchers, the rest was barely 30% full. Greeter said we have a 15 minute wait. Reason? The kitchen just got slammed with orders. I could care less. How about getting us a table ( I see at least 5 empty for our party of 5), taking our drink order, then explaining why we should not order for 10 - 15 minutes. Now that would be good customer service. Instead we were given a vibrating box and told no to stand but sit at the long benches along the hall. I may eat at Chili's again, bet never in Temecula.

I was going to an event nearby where they don't serve food. I was hungry, feeling cheap, and in a hurry, so Chili's seemed perfect.  I parked my booty at the bar and was greeted right away by Jimmy. He made a few suggestions while we perused the selections available on tap. A large Stella and Dos XX ran $6 each, not bad.  I decided to share the 2/$20 deal with my my date. We opted for the chips with guac as our appetizer. Our main entrees were the grilled chicken salad, and the 6oz sirloin. The sirloin was surprisingly tasty and needed no extra seasoning or sauce. I ordered my steak medium rare, and it actually came out that way! Most places like Chilis have a tendency to overcook the meat, and have no idea what the difference is between medium rare and well done.  +1 star for cooking and seasoning the steak properly. +1 star for Jimmy, who never let my glass get empty and could keep up with the witty banter.

Place has horrible service and order was completely wrong. Had to wait another 10 mins to get the correct food. This place is horrible. Watriss has apologized to other customers for getting their order wrong. Come on guys get it together.
This is always our GO-TO place in Temecula, great, fast service, excellent drinks, best one in the area!

So disappointed! Chili's used to be one of our favorite places to eat. No longer. My husband and I both had the 6z sirloin tonight, only to find it tasteless! The vegetables and potatoes that came with it had more seasoning! And my son who loves having chicken nuggets and fries when we go out, didn't even make it through one nugget. It looked gross so I didn't blame him. Who batters nuggets in the same batter you would use on fish? It was more batter than nuggets. The service wasn't great either. We kept having to repeat ourselves to our server. He even came back to the table to ask my husband what he had ordered for a drink. Water! Sorry, not coming back to this place again.

With all the restaurants that have come to Temecula over the years, Chili's isn't top on my list of places to go but I received a gift card so we decided to use it. Called ahead for a busy Saturday night and we were able to be seated right away but what's the point when it takes almost an hour to get your food, that isn't even cooked all the way!! Very disappointing, glad I had gift certificates but I sure have no desire to go back to Chili's anytime soon.

Somehow I end up with Chili's gift cars A LOT.  I don't know why, but we keep going primarily for that reason.  The food is good, but nothing ever really phenomenal.  We've also taken to getting the $20 dinner for 2 since it is a good deal.  Usually busy unless you go early and the staff is neither friendly nor rude.  Yeah, pretty average, I think that sums up Chili's quite well.

My boyfriend & I go in all the time & love it. Unfortunately today I can't say the same. The server took our drink orders. After that another group got sat down, got their drinks & food order in before we did & we couldn't even get a glass of water.needless to say we left after waiting for about 10-15 ridiculous minutes. Please rehire new servers with experience

Terrible service. Drinks and food are good , as is other Chili's locations. Seriously, in a time when jobs are few and workers plenty one would think the manager would strive to have quality workers. Pathetic. Never coming here again!

Chili's is one of my favorite restaurants. To me, it's a place you can go and know your food will always be delicious. I always have to get the skillet queso, which also comes with their home-made salsa, delicious!  The service there is always excellent, we are never waiting for drink refills or too long for our food to be prepared. When you're with your family and you all can't decide what to eat, Chili's is always that great, go-to place that will make everyone happy.
I always come in for a nice drink and appetizer. I usually only get a burger if I order off of the main menu. I love all of their margaritas and apps.

This Chili's really does not live up to my standards. The service is horrible the food is really hit or miss. There a Chili's everywhere, so you should know what you're getting. However, with this Chili's, it really is hit or miss. Miss, more often than not.  If you're really in the mood for Chili's, drive a little bit further and go to the one in Murrieta. They are one of the best I've been to.

To be honest, I was surprised by how well the waiters and food came out! The waiters were friendly and the food delicious!  Except for one dish called the Mango Tilapia or something like that was not to my liking. It tasted funny, but me thinking I was just being paranoid, thought that the mango topping was a bit too tangy for my taste. Now here comes the kicker, day after eating at Chili's I'm driving to school and my vision begins to blur...what was that all about? And soon enough I'm in class and can hardly stand the pain of a headache reaching painful standards. I literally had to walk out of class and miss my other class for my body was not willing to function with the pain.  I barely make it to my car and guess what? Yeah threw up, so I'm guessing that not all of Chili's food is of high quality. So if you still want to eat there after reading this AVOID THE MANGO TILAPIA AT ALL COSTS! Not worth the food poisoning trust me. Probably won't eat there again.

After a long drive home after snowboarding my pals and I decided to stop by grab a bit while traffic died down. Everyone was set on a Chili's so I put my Yelp Mobile to use and found this location. I gotta tell you that the location is awesome! They have a pond right next to the entrace with ducks swimming around. It's located in a strip mall of storts with several other chain restaurants around and a condo complex with another lake that has a gaizer shooting up feet high!  We walked in during the begining of happy hour and there were only a few people sitting at the bar. They were showing the Colts game so we decided to sit in their bar area. Our drink order was taken rather quickly and we ordered a couple of salads. A ceasar salad for me and a buffalo chicken salad for my buddy. I got my salad w/ some sort or orangy dressing. I put it on my salad and tasted it.....Hmmm! I've ordered this salad before and have never seen it like that. I told the rest of the group to try it. "Tell me if this is Thousand Island dressing," I said. It kinda tasted like Ceasar but it had some spice in it! Everyone said "It's Thousand Island!" I told the waiter and he explained that they had just changed the dressing on it about a week ago.....yup, that was the cesar dressing. Not so good I might add. For the most part this is just your typical Chilis nothing to special about it.
The waitress was pretty bad, and she appeared racist as she made one of my Chilean colleagues move seats.. Food was late, bussing was inadequate, and even billing was unsatisfactory.

So I was visiting the family out in temecula. Mentioned the 3 course meals for $20. My grandma wanted to try it out so we went there for lunch. We started with the queso skillet which was pretty good. As for our main meals, she got the bacon burger which was so big but delicious and I got the new thick BBQ sauce ribs. Sorry I forgot the name but it's a bit thick but very flavorful.  Finally we ended with the brownie sundae, and that is bomb!  I like chili's and it's always a 4 star joint. Especially when they have this great special going on. Go b4 this special ends.

They were late little bit in taking our order but when we did the order we didn't like our dish. They took it even though we ate 25% from it. They said they'll drop it from the bill and we told them its ok we will pay for it. Then when we asked for the bill it was dropped from it
Always come here and no complaints. My favorite is the texas cheese fries! YUM!

Hey Chili's!  What gives?  My wife went to your location on Rancho California to have lunch before catching a movie.  When we walked in we were told there was a wait, but there was room in the bar.  So we figured what the heck we need to make the movie.  Just as we sat down another couple came in and were immediately seated in the main room.  Then a second couple right behind them, then a third.  Can you believe it?  So we waited for service in the bar for 15 minutes and were totally ignored so we decided to go to subway and get something quick.  But before we left we asked the hostess why the other couples were seated and we were told there was a wait?  She gave us some excuse about a shift change or something.  I thought...30 seconds after us?  In Chili's defense I will say that the other couples were older than us and should be seated in the main dining room...but that makes us feel like second class citizens....sorry we won't be back.

My husband and I stopped by this restaurant last Friday about three in the afternoon. Not very crowded,the service was great!!! The greeter/hostess was very friendly as we enetered and was seated right away. The waitress came shortly and brought our drinks and returned in a timely matter to take our orders. The food was yummy!!! The waitress also was very attentive,watching to see if we needed refills on our drinks,and asked how our day was going and if we wanted desert or anything else. I would recommend this place highly-We usually have gone to the California Oaks location in Murrieta when go on Friday nights to the movies!!! This is the perfect location and will return with no doubt and recommend it to all my friends and family. The atmosphere is nice and relaxing,restrooms and the restaurant very clean.

Was on my way to San Diego and had never been to Chili's. so we decided to stop in. It was around 930 or 10 and we sat in the Bar area. Happy hour drinks were great and so were the appetizers. Food was good, just as i expected. Our server was the bartender and he was real great too. If Im ever in the area again it is somewhere I would visit again for sure

If I never went to a Chili's again, that would be perfect with me. It is beyond me why this place was crowded. Even for generic American fare, this disappointed. My husband got the ribs, which were dry and overcooked, and the grilled shrimp-way too much seasoning and rubbery(again, overcooked). My daughter and I got their "tacos", one shrimp, one chicken... They should just call them wraps and forget the "taco" angle. Even at that, the seasoning was off by a mile. Service was fine. They need to re-think the menu and retrain the cooks.

I just came back from them after putting an order online thinking everything had been paid for in advance at the very computer am doing the review on. I order some chicken crispers, a pumpkin spice lava cake, and a strawberry lemonade togo. I had seen the confirm page and a time to pick up my food. So I go all they to the place walk in without my wallet because I figured I was not driving and no point to bring it right. I come being told the online payment was done and that I needed the card to pay with. I told them I didn't have the card because the site gave me in bold letters a confirm and time to pick up my food.  If it did say online payment down it was in small font that I didn't bother to read and that is my fault. What burns me is the fact the had my cell number and didn't call me to confirm if I knew that before I arrive, they burn me again to go call someone to read the card number off for me, but that meant I would have to have my wife how just gave birth to twins and had a c-section to get out of bed to read the card that was in the office. The third and final burn was when they told me go go home to call them and read the card number to them but would not let me take the food with me to do that. So lets recap the last part that I had to go home, call them, read a card number to them, then come back to pick up my food that by that time am sure would of been cold by the time I got home, after make two back and fourth trips to pick up cold food. I wont be buying from this place again because these could of been avoid all together if someone at the place would have bother to take a five second phone to me to tell me the online payment was done and to bring my card.

We thiknk this place is great. Our server Megan is outstanding. Food is always hot and fresh. She walays checks our drinks and if we need anything , it's taken care of. We enjoy the 2 for $20 menu and although they don't have a large selection for dessert, what they do have are delicious. If you go, ask for Megan and tell her Craig and Kathy sent you. She'll take great care of you.

Well I guess I got what I paid for... The food was bland & uneventful... I wish they would have a dish or salad that wasn't smothered with animal products!!! A few Vegan options would be nice!!! Would it kill them to carry alternative burger patty choices????

Had a wonderful experience when I went there for a lunch date with my grandma! Our server Christian was amazing! He was super friendly, got our food out fast, knew exactly what we needed when we needed it and even offered to get us cups to go for our waters which I've never had a serve ask that! A+++ for him!!! The Cajan Chicken pasta and the Chicken fajitas are to die for and the fact they are on the 2 for $20 menu is AMAZING!!! We will be back very soon!

I love Chili's! The new iPad menus on the tables are genius especially the games.  The food was great, as always. The appetizers were perfect! Sliders will always be my favorite next to the chips and skillet queso. The wait times can get busy, but hey, what good restaurant doesn't?! The hostess and hostesses are always nice. The servers could be a little nicer though. Will always come back.
Typical chain, nothing special.  Food not flavorful, just there.
No stars bad bad service always every single time I've gone there in temecula honestly and that's been since '89

Good choice of American food (aka burgers, fried stuff and the occasional healthy dish,) flawless presentation and appetizing prices makes my first visit to chili's (yes, it's true and I'm proud of the fact!) a good one. I ordered the combo for $10 - I chose the Southwestern Eggrolls with a creamy dipping sauce and  Half Rack of Ribs (Memphis Dry Rub) which was a bit dry. The entree came with a choice of side dish - I got the mashed potato. Samantha ordered the Buffalo Chicken Fajitas which is crispy chicken, spicy wing sauce and bleu cheese crumbles served with a plate of beans, crispy lettuce and torillas. That was a lot of food for not a lot of money. I'd come to a Chili's again when I want some reliable comfort food if I'm not worried about my calories. If you're this close to Old Town Temecula why not go there? Well, there aren't many Asians in that picturesque part of town and overhearing a rowdy table of hicks mimicking the Asian catch phrase "one dollaaar, one dollaaar" persuaded us leave that joint and we bumped into Chili's.
Horrible service for lunch had to get manager to get a beer. Food took half an hour. Bartender could not handle four tables of parties of two.. really

I work right next to this chili's and every single time I come the food is either cold or just not cooked properly. My #1 complaint about this location is the rude waitresses and that jerk of a manager (black bald guy) . unbelievably rude. Today we were called an asshole by someone who had to take our food back because we asked for medium well steak and received an over cooked well done steak. The black manager came to the table because earlier in the night we ordered guacamole which I happened to almost break my tooth on an avacodo pit told me that they don't take things off the check but can give us a small discount. The only nice one in there was the kitchen manager who was very sweet and friendly. So sad they just lost a customer that comes 2-3 times a week because I work next door. Horrible horrible location. They let me down every time.

Make sure and double check your account after you eat here folks!!!! My server accidentally charged my card twice when splitting the check with my friend instead of running her card at all. Which was totally fine cuz we noticed and he voided my extra charge off but I checked my bank account while sitting there only to notice an ADDITIONAL charge of 52 dollars to my account!!! Our check was only 35 so it made no sense. Naturally I asked what happened and The server/bartender Joshua informed me that he accidentally charged my card but had fixed it. His story made no sense (I'm pretty convinced he ran my card on another tables check) I asked for some kind of receipt proving they had reversed the charge and was given nothing! not even a sorry by the manager on duty. They informed me that the charge "should "be off by Saturday . Welp it's Monday and the charge is still there. I just called back and again not even a sorry was treated like a inconvenience that they took 52 extra dollars from me. He told me it should be fixed in the next few days but we will see! Ridiculous that they think it's ok to treat their customers this way. I will say I Have been eating at chilis for years and think it's just this location that is ran poorly.
A great go to for our family. Food is always good, staff always friendly and efficient.
The food isn't quite good enough to compensate for the poor service and the ridiculous wait times on Friday and Saturday nights.

I gave one star because i was COMPLETELY DISSATISFIED!!!! The food was terrible and tasted like it was made the day before or worse. The service was subpar and the guy "Jesse" seemed like we were an inconvenience to him. When we asked if the a/c could be turned up cuz my fiance was cold he said "it will take a few minutes cuz it's an old system" but it never shut off. They obviously didnt care about us being comfortable or spending our money there. If it wasn't for my fiance being so nice we wouldnt have paid for anything but the beer i drank. Speaking of, the one "plus" was that i enjoyed my 2 beers and the 2nd was delivered pretty quickly.  I understand that nobodies perfect and i am a bit critical when it comes to food and food service, but at the same time it doesnt take too much to satisfy me. Some decent food and semi-attentive service with a smile is all it takes. needless to say i will not be coming back to this chilis EVER again!!!

We went in today around 5:30pm. The bar area filled up pretty quick after we arrived. We got chips and salsa and our drinks to start. They arrived promptly and were delicious. My son ordered pizza with pineapple for his side and loved it. I ordered the Cajun pasta with chicken and shrimp. It was so tasty. My husband ordered the chicken bacon avocado sandwich and he was quite happy with it. Our server was great as well, Megan V was her name. Thank you.

Meh.  This location is very inconsistent. I could go in one night, and the service and food will be satisfactory. The next time, the tables and menus will be sticky and the food will give me horrible food poisoning. Honestly, if you are in the mood for some casual dining, drive the extra few minutes to the Applebee's on 79 South. They have better food and are much cleaner.

Don't purchase gift cards for chills! We received a gift card the other day and decided to go have dinner. The gift card had $50.00 printed on the card by the company. When they scanned the gift card it only showed $15.00 on the card but had never been used. So chills pocketed the $50 and only gave $15.00 we paid the rest of the bill out of pocket. What theives! I had to leave a rating but the food was horrible and they questioned are integrity. I wouldn't give them any stars other than our waitress was great!

I was a bit disappointed. I ordered sliders and asked that they be cooked medium/rare (and emphasized rare) because they seem to always come out burnt if I don't mention this and they still came out burnt. Oh well.... I did mention this to the server and they deducted it from the bill and by then I was already good with the appetizers and fries. I'd consider my visit OK only because my meal was comped. I'll try again in 6 months.

Went on a Tuesday night. Horrible service. Our waitress didn't give us refills or silverware. My husband had to go back in the kitchen and ask for our drinks and utensils. She also wouldn't give us a military discount because he wasn't in uniform...he's not even allowed to be in uniform for something like that. I think she was just being lazy...they've done the discount before. The ONLY reason I gave 2 stars is because the food was good.

LOUD!  I realize this is a family place to eat, but there are constantly kids screaming! That would be OK if the food and service was good, but it is not! Average food, average service. I would say you get what you pay for, but the prices are actually high for this type of food.

Dining here was ok. The drinks were really good, had a Cadillac margarita and a couple brews. Idk if it's the location or the set up inside that gives this place a boring feel to it, that's just my opinion. Kind of  bland overall.
the pork caritas fajitas are bomb dot com!
Just had the $20. For 2 meal - chicken fajitas & bacon jack grilled chicken) great deal as you get an appetizer as well.  Our server BRIA gets 5 stars!!!!

Came here on a Saturday night at about eight o'clock. It wasn't busy and our server was very prompt. Ordered a glass of wine (meh...) and my husband got a beer. We got chips and salsa and corn guacamole (i LOVED the salsa, he LOVED the guac), cajun chicken pasta, and fajitas. Everything was good. My pasta was a bit bland but I expected it to be (come on, it's Chilis, not Italy) and my hubby's fajitas were actually pretty tasty! After my vodka and soda was delivered, we paid our bill, which was delivered promptly after the server offered dessert, and we left! It was nothing exciting, but it was relaxing, filling, and everything someone might expect from a Temecula Chili's. Will return.
Zach was our server for my daughter and I and he did a fantastic job!  Very attentive and engaging.  Food was very good, I had the fajitas and they were excellent!  Thank you Zach!

You can never go wrong with Chili's! I had a drink and appetizers there with a couple of friends. Appetizers were good, but they seem to have a lot of sodium, which is no good! I do admit though, their cosmopolitan and appletini is good!

If you find yourself in the desert of Southern California and are in need of sustenance and friendly faces, go to this Chili's.  The staff there were incredibly friendly.  Heck, everyone down here seems to be so happy to help you out.  The food, of course, is your typical Chili's fare.  The drinks pack more of a punch than their counterparts on the east coast.  All in all, we had a good time and were able to decompress after spending a long day of corporate training in a windowless room.

To start things off Chilis is my favorite restaurant.  I typically go to the Murrieta location, but this particular time I went to Temecula.  The first time ever I saw a rusty penny in my wife's salad dressing.  The food was over cooked and the server could not handle all of her tables.  My wife never received a refill and my second beer finally arrived right before the check.  Was very disappointed and will go the extra distance next time.

Chili's is always a great bargain as compared to the prices of other sit down restaurants.  I'm vegetarian, and although I wish they had more selections for a vegetarian, I always find something on their menu that is delicious.  Chili's has always been very accommodating to customizing my orders to omit the meat. I travel a lot, so whenever I see a Chili's too in the airport, I know I can get a great meal at a good price, that is far superior to other airport food.  I also have the added benefit of a familiar menu, that I know what I will get.  I don't know if regular Chili's offer breakfast, but the breakfasts available at the airport are always the best!

Over priced drinks during Happy Hour.  Cheapest Cab was over$6.50 for a small portion. Food was too greasy and chicken was overlooked and tough, although portions were large. Overpriced, could have had better meal at lower cost even at many other places in town. Service was good but not enough to overcome negative opinion. Live here but will not eat there again.
